plot.observations: heavy infestation starting ~1988 or 1989 (epecially oaks)/ heavy frass production.
Multiple individuals were caught on 4 purple pherone traps hung in the plot over the summer.
at least one group of trees (including a very large one) observed freshly fallen a few days after the storm
minor damage with fallen branches, but no large treefall observed
observer(s): Ian McGregor, Alyssa Terrell, Becky Banbury Morgan

plot.observations: There was a little bit of flooding in the stream and some fallen branches (small ones) that looked fresh but nothing irregular. One large snag snapped midway and affected a tree next to it in the 1220 area

event.details: SCBI contractor trimmed stems and branches close to road (trimming within plot occurred because of miscommuncation)
plot.observations: Small stems and branches within ~2-3 feet of road were cut. This probably affected ~100 stems. There were at least 15-20 small stems (<=5cm) that were completely cut. Overhanging branches of larger trees (mainly beech) were trimmed to a height of ~15-20 feet.

event.details: tag #200038 was hit by lightning sometime between fall 2019 and March 11, 2020.
plot.observations: Dendro band on this tree exploded!

event.details: spotted lantern fly : Warren Co. added to list of quarantine counties
observer(s): Commonwealth of Virginia Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services.

event.details: There apparently was an incident with one of the fencing crew delivery drivers.  The truck got stuck and needed a skid-steer to help dislodge it, but during this process there was some damage to one of the side streams of the creek and 3 trees within the ForestGeo Plot.
plot.observations: The three trees that were nicked are 042056 at the blue DBH markers, 052010 at the base of the tree, and 052003 also at the base of the tree
